info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 16 at 9:43PM PDT until August 17 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...ISOLATED TO SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS EXPECTED THIS WEEK... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM TO 11 PM PDT THURSDAY FOR ABUNDANT LIGHTNING ON DRY FUELS FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 280, 281, 282, 284, 285, 621, 623, AND 624... * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop have a high probability of spreading rapidly. Abundant lightning can also ignite new fires and strain fire fighting resources. * AFFECTED AREA...In California...portions of Fire weather zones 280...281...284 and 285. In Oregon...Fire weather zones 621, 623 and 624. This includes portions of the Rogue River-Siskiyou, Fremont-Winema, Klamath, and Modoc National Forests. * THUNDERSTORMS...Isolated showers and thunderstorms are expected overnight into Thursday morning, followed by additional scattered thunderstorms Thursday afternoon and evening. Storms will trend wetter on Thursday, but lightning strikes outside of the wet cores are still likely. * OUTFLOW WINDS...Gusts 30 to 40 mph. * DETAILED URL...View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: Avoid tossing burning cigarettes on the ground, parking hot vehicles on dry vegetation, and using equipment that can cause sparks. Follow all fire restrictions. Find links to restrictions at weather.gov/medford/wildfire. One less spark, one less wildfire. Gather your fire evacuation kit now. Collect essentials you don`t want to lose and prioritize your checklist. Visit ready.gov/kit for more information. Familiarize yourself with your evacuation plan. Where will you go? How will you get there? Who will you call to let others know your are safe? Visit ready.gov/wildfires for more information. A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now or will shortly. These conditions promote rapid spread of fire which may become life threatening. Evacuate if ordered to, or if a fire threatens.
